title: Healer
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | The Healer is a priest of Elyvilon. Healers begin with minor healing powers, but can gain far greater abilities in the long run. They are able to persuade monsters to abstain from bloodshed, gaining both piety and experience that way. |

**Healers** are followers of [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon") the Healer. Elyvilon's creed is one of pacifism, and her worshipers can actually pacify monsters by healing them. However, they are forbidden from harming non-hostile monsters, letting their allies die, or using any form of evil magic or weapons.

Healers start the game with 55 [piety](/Piety "Piety").

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Races](#Preferred_Races)
- [2 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Stategy](#Stategy)
- [6 History](#History)

## Preferred Races

[Deep Dwarf](/Deep_Dwarf "Deep Dwarf"), [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc"), [Naga](/Naga "Naga"), [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") and [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") are the recommended races if you pick a Healer Background.

## Racial Restrictions

[Demigods](/Demigod "Demigod"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn"), [Ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [Mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), and [Vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") may not be Healers, as they are banned from worshipping Elyvilon.

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +1 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [Potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing")
- [Potion of heal wounds](/Potion_of_heal_wounds "Potion of heal wounds")
- 2 [bread rations](/Bread_ration "Bread ration")

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 1
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 2
- [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations"): 3

Choosing Healer adds 4 to your starting [Strength](/Strength "Strength"), [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Stategy

Pacification is a more powerful ability than it may seem at first, allowing you to [smite](/Smite "Smite")-target dangerous beasts and remove them from the fight entirely. Just be aware that doing so grants you less XP than killing the thing.

## History

Healers were removed in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").

Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), Healers started with 100 [gold](/Gold "Gold"), 2 levels of fighting, and only one bread ration.

Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Healers started with 4 levels of Invocations.

| Zealots                                 | [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") • [Chaos Knight](/Chaos_Knight "Chaos Knight") • [Cinder Acolyte](/Cinder_Acolyte "Cinder Acolyte")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Warrior-mages                           | [Warper](/Warper "Warper") • [Hexslinger](/Hexslinger "Hexslinger") • [Enchanter](/Enchanter "Enchanter") • [Reaver](/Reaver "Reaver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Mages                                   | [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") • [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer") • [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner") • [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer") • [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist") • [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist") • [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist") • [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist") • [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist") |
| Adventurers                             | [Artificer](/Artificer "Artificer") • [Shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") • [Wanderer](/Wanderer "Wanderer") • [Delver](/Delver "Delver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
html:
Healer

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
The Healer is a priest of Elyvilon. Healers begin with minor healing powers, but can gain far greater abilities in the long run. They are able to persuade monsters to abstain from bloodshed, gaining both piety and experience that way.

Healers are followers of Elyvilon the Healer. Elyvilon's creed is one of pacifism, and her worshipers can actually pacify monsters by healing them. However, they are forbidden from harming non-hostile monsters, letting their allies die, or using any form of evil magic or weapons.

Healers start the game with 55 piety.

Contents

  • 1 Preferred Races
  • 2 Racial Restrictions
  • 3 Starting Equipment
  • 4 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 5 Stategy
  • 6 History

Preferred Races

Deep Dwarf, Hill Orc, Naga, Minotaur, Draconian and Gargoyle are the recommended races if you pick a Healer Background.

Racial Restrictions

Demigods, Demonspawn, Ghouls, Mummies, and Vampires may not be Healers, as they are banned from worshipping Elyvilon.

Starting Equipment

Some species may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

  • +1 robe
  • Potion of curing
  • Potion of heal wounds
  • 2 bread rations

Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' aptitudes.

  • Fighting: 1
  • Dodging: 2
  • Invocations: 3

Choosing Healer adds 4 to your starting Strength, Intelligence and Dexterity.

Stategy

Pacification is a more powerful ability than it may seem at first, allowing you to smite-target dangerous beasts and remove them from the fight entirely. Just be aware that doing so grants you less XP than killing the thing.

History

Healers were removed in 0.16.

Prior to 0.15, Healers started with 100 gold, 2 levels of fighting, and only one bread ration.

Prior to 0.14, Healers started with 4 levels of Invocations.

Backgrounds
Warriors Fighter • Gladiator • Monk • Hunter • Brigand
Zealots Berserker • Chaos Knight • Cinder Acolyte
Warrior-mages Warper • Hexslinger • Enchanter • Reaver
Mages Hedge Wizard • Conjurer • Summoner • Necromancer • Fire Elementalist • Ice Elementalist • Air Elementalist • Earth Elementalist • Alchemist
Adventurers Artificer • Shapeshifter • Wanderer • Delver
